00024 using namespace std;

00026 static const char Usage[] =
00027 "\n"
00028 "\n"
00029 "Usage: orcaroot [options] [input file(s) / socket host:port]\n"
00030 "\n"
00031 "The one required argument is either the name of a file to be processed or\n"
00032 "a host and port of a socket from which to read data. For a file, you may\n"
00033 "enter a series of files to be processed, or use a wildcard like \"file*.dat\"\n"
00034 "For a socket, the argument should be formatted as host:port.\n"
00035 "\n"
00036 "Available options:\n"
00037 "  --help : print this message and exit\n"
00038 "  --verbosity [verbosity] : set the severity/verbosity for the logger.\n"
00039 "    Choices are: debug, trace, routine, warning, error, and fatal.\n"
00040 "  --label [label] : use [label] as prefix for root output file name.\n"
00041 "\n"
00042 "Example usage:\n"
00043 "orcaroot run194ecpu\n"
00044 "  Rootify local file run194ecpu with default verbosity, output file label, etc.\n"
00045 "orcaroot run*\n"
00046 "  Same as before, but run over all files beginning with \"run\".\n"
00047 "orcaroot --verbosity debug --label mylabel run194ecpu\n"
00048 "  The same, but with example usage of the verbosity and mylabel options.\n"
00049 "  An output file will be created with name mylabel_run194.root, and lots\n"
00050 "  of debugging output will appear.\n"
00051 "orcaroot 128.95.100.213:44666\n"
00052 "  Rootify orca stream on host 128.95.100.213, port 44666 with default verbosity,\n"
00053 "  output file label, etc.\n"
00054 "\n"
00055 "\n";
00056 
00057 
00058 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00059 {
00060   if(argc == 1) {
00061     ORLog(kError) << "You must supply some options" << endl << Usage;
00062     return 1;
00063   }
00064 
00065 
00066   static struct option longOptions[] = {
00067     {"help", no_argument, 0, 'h'},
00068     {"verbosity", required_argument, 0, 'v'},
00069     {"label", required_argument, 0, 'l'},
00070   };
00071 
00072   string label = "OR";
00073   ORVReader* reader = NULL;
00074 
00075   while(1) {
00076     char optId = getopt_long(argc, argv, "", longOptions, NULL);
00077     if(optId == -1) break;
00078     switch(optId) {
00079       case('h'): // help
00080         cout << Usage;
00081         return 0;
00082       case('v'): // verbosity
00083         if(strcmp(optarg, "debug") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kDebug);
00084         else if(strcmp(optarg, "trace") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kTrace);
00085         else if(strcmp(optarg, "routine") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kRoutine);
00086         else if(strcmp(optarg, "warning") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kWarning);
00087         else if(strcmp(optarg, "error") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kError);
00088         else if(strcmp(optarg, "fatal") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kFatal);
00089         else {
00090           ORLog(kWarning) << "Unknown verbosity setting " << optarg 
00091                           << "; using kRoutine" << endl;
00092           ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kRoutine);
00093         }
00094         break;
00095       case('l'): // label
00096         label = optarg;
00097         break;
00098       default: // unrecognized option
00099         ORLog(kError) << Usage;
00100         return 1;
00101     }
00102   }
00103 
00104   if (argc <= optind) {
00105     ORLog(kError) << "You must supply a filename or socket host:port" << endl
00106                   << Usage << endl;
00107     return 1;
00108   }
00109 
00110   string readerArg = argv[optind];
00111   size_t iColon = readerArg.find(":");
00112   if (iColon == string::npos) {
00113     reader = new ORIgorFileReader;
00114     for (int i=optind; i<argc; i++) {
00115       ((ORFileReader*) reader)->AddFileToProcess(argv[i]);
00116     }
00117   } else {
00118     reader = new ORSocketReader(readerArg.substr(0, iColon).c_str(), 
00119                                 atoi(readerArg.substr(iColon+1).c_str()));
00120   }
00121 
00122   if (!reader->OKToRead()) {
00123     ORLog(kError) << "Reader couldn't read" << endl;
00124     return 1;
00125   }
00126 
00127   ORLog(kRoutine) << "Setting up data processing manager..." << endl;
00128   ORDataProcManager dataProcManager(reader);
00129 
00130   //ORDGF4cEventDumper theDumper;
00131   //dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&theDumper);
00132   ORFileWriter theFileWriter("DGF");
00133   dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&theFileWriter);
00134  // ORDGF4cWaveformTreeWriter theWFWriter("DGFTest");
00135 //  dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&theWFWriter);
00136 
00137   ORDGF4cEnergyTreeWriter test;
00138   dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&test);
00139   //test.SetThisProcessorFillsTree();  
00140 
00141 //  ORDGF4cMCAWriter mcaWriter;
00142 //  dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&mcaWriter);
00143 
00144 
00145   ORLog(kRoutine) << "Start processing..." << endl;
00146   dataProcManager.ProcessDataStream();
00147   ORLog(kRoutine) << "Finished processing..." << endl;
00148 
00149   delete reader;
00150 
00151   return 0;
00152 }
